Name: Alan
Other features: Allows sequence alignments to be viewed quickly and directly in a linux terminal without X-forwarding

Name: Ale (emacs plugin)
Other features: No

Name: AliView 2021
Can align sequences: MUSCLE integrated; other programs such as MAFFT can be defined
Can calculate phylogenetic trees: External programs such as FastTree can be called from within
Other features: Fast, easy navigation through unlimited mouse wheel zoom in-out feature. Handles unlimited file size alignments. Degenerate primer design.
Format support: FASTA, FASTQ, PHYLIP, Nexus, MSF, Clustal

Name: alv
Other features: Console-based (no GUI), yet with colors. Coding DNA is coloured by codon.
Link: Official website, see also alv on GitHub

Name: arb
Structure prediction tools integrated: structure editable, show bond in helix sequence regions, 2D molecule viewer
Can calculate phylogenetic trees: arb-parsimony & -NJ, RAxML, PHYML, Phylip, FastTree2, MrBayes
Other features: Edits huge alignments and trees. Supports NUCs + AA. Displays codons below DNA. Custom column highlighting (e.g. by conservation profiles). Designs, matches and visualizes probes.
License: Proprietary, freeware, arb license, open modifiable source

Name: Base-By-Base
Can calculate phylogenetic trees: UPGMA, NJ, complete and single linkages, WPMGA
Other features: Visual summary, percent identity tables, some integrated advanced analysis tools
Format support: Genbank, FASTA, EMBEL, Clustal, base-by-base files

Name: BioEdit
Other features: Plasmid drawing, ABI chromatograms,

Name: bioSyntax
Other features: Native syntax highlighting support for Vim, less, gedit and Sublime
Format support: FASTA, FASTQ, Clustal, SAM, VCF and more

Name: BoxShade
Other features: Specifically for multiple alignments
Format support: MSF format as written by PILEUP, READSEQ, or SEQIO (fmtseq); ALN format as written by ClustalW

Name: CINEMA
Structure prediction tools integrated: No, but can read-show 2D structure annotations
Other features: Dotplot, 6 frame translation, Blast
Format support: Nexus, MSF, Clustal, FASTA, PHYLIP, PIR, PRINTS

Name: CLC viewer (free version)
Can align sequences: Clustal, MUSCLE, T-Coffee, MAFFT, Kalign, various
Other features: Workflows, blast-genbank search
License: Proprietary, freeware. More options available in commercial versions.

Name: ClustalX viewer
Other features: Alignment quality analysis

Name: Cylindrical Alignment App
Other features: 3D, animation, drilldown, legend selection
Format support: BLAST XML, proprietary XML, GFF3, ClustalW, INSDSet, user expandable with XSLT
License: Free, CDDL 1. Available for dual licensing.

Name: Cylindrical BLAST Viewer
Other features: 3D, animation, drilldown, legend selection
Format support: BLAST XML, proprietary XML, GFF3, ClustalW, INSDSet, user expandable with XSLT

Name: DECIPHER
Other features: Primer-Probe design, Chimera finding

Name: Discovery Studio
Can calculate phylogenetic trees: UPGMA, NJ, with bootstrap and best tree
Other features: Visualizer supports 2D and 3D structure and sequence; full version has comprehensive functionality for protein, nucleotides, more
Format support: BSML, EMBL, GB, HELM, Clustal, FASTA, GDE, PDB, SEQ, SPT, ...

Name: DnaSP
Other features: Can compute several population genetics statistics, reconstruct haplotypes with PHASE
License: Proprietary, commercial, freeware for noncomercial use

Name: DNASTAR Lasergene Molecular Biology Suite
Other features: Align DNA, RNA, protein, or DNA + protein sequences via a variety of pairwise and multiple sequence alignment algorithms, generate phylogenetic trees to predict evolutionary relationships, explore sequence tracks to view GC content, gap fraction, sequence logos, translation
Format support: ABI, DNA Multi-Seq, FASTA, GCG Pileup, GenBank, Phred

Name: FLAK
Can align sequences: Can perform fuzzy whole genome alignment
Other features: Very fast, highly customisable, visualisation is WYSIWYG with filtering and fuzzy options
License: Proprietary, commercial, freeware for noncommercial use

Name: Genedoc
Other features: gel simulation, stats, multiple views, simple

Name: Geneious
Can calculate phylogenetic trees: UPGMA, NJ, PhyML, MrBayes plugin, PAUP* plugin
Other features: Whole genome assembly, restriction analysis, cloning, primer design, dotplot, much more

Name: Integrated Genome Browser (IGB)
Other features: Sequences and features from files, URLs, and arbitrary DAS and QuickLoad servers

Name: interactive Tree Of Life (iTOL)
Other features: Phylogenetic tree viewer-annotation tool which can visualise alignments directly on the tree. Various other dataset types can be displayed in addition to alignments.

Name: IVisTMSA
Can align sequences: Clustal Omega, ClustalW2, MAFFT, MUSCLE, BioJava are integrated to construct alignment
Can calculate phylogenetic trees: Tree calculation tool calculates phylogenetic tree using BioJava API and lets user draw trees using Archaeopteryx
Other features: Software is package of 7 interactive visual tools for multiple sequence alignments. Major focus is manipulating large alignments. Includes MSApad, MSA comparator, MSA reconstruction tool, FASTA generator and MSA ID matrix calculator
Format support: ClustalW, MSF, PHYLIP, PIR, GDE, Nexus

Name: Jalview
Can align sequences: Clustal, MUSCLE, MAFFT, Probcons, TCoffee via web services
Other features: Sequences and features from arbitrary and publicly registered DAS servers, PFAM, PDB, EMBL, Uniprot Accession retrieval.
Format support: FASTA, PFAM, MSF, Clustal, BLC, PIR, Stockholm

Name: Jevtrace
Other features: A multivalent browser for sequence alignment, phylogeny, and structure. Performs an interactive Evolutionary Trace and other phylogeny inspired analysis.
Format support: FASTA, MSF, Clustal, PHYLIP, Newick, PDB
License: Proprietary, commercial, freeware for academic use

Name: JSAV
Other features: A JavaScript component allowing integrating an alignment viewer into web pages

Name: Lucid Align
Other features: Native desktop alignment viewer, uses trackpad/mouse gestures. Allows streaming remote data
License: Proprietary, commercial, freeware for academic use

Name: Maestro
Other features: Mapping from sequence to 3D structure, structure-sequence editing-modeling

Name: MEGA
Can calculate phylogenetic trees: UPGMA, NJ, ME, MP, with bootstrap and confidence test
Other features: Extended support to phylogenetics analysis

Name: Molecular Operating Environment (MOE)
Other features: Part of an extensive collection of applications for sequence to structure, including homology modelling; 3D visualisation, etc.
Format support: Clustal, FASTA, PDB, EMBL, GCG, GCG_MSF, Genbank, PHYLIP, PIR, raw_seq

Name: MSAReveal.org
Other features: Optional coloring. Touching AA shows 3-letter code and sequence number. Touching consensus shows AA frequencies in that column. Counts and percentages of aromatics, charged, gaps.
License: Free, Creative Commons Attribution NonCommercial Share-alike

Name: Multiseq (VMD plugin)
Structure prediction tools integrated: No, but can display and align 3D structures
Other features: Scripting via Tcl, mapping from sequence to 3D structure
License: Proprietary, freeware, but VMD is free for noncommercial use only

Name: MView
Other features: Stacked alignments from blast and fasta suites, various MSA format conversions, HTML markup, consensus patterns
Format support: BLAST search, FASTA search, Clustal, HSSP, FASTA, PIR, MSF

Name: PFAAT
Other features: Manual annotation, conservation scores

Name: Ralee (emacs plugin for RNA al. editing)
S2S RNA editor
Other features: Base-base interactions, 2D-3D viewer

Name: Seaview
Other features: Dot-plot, vim-like editing keys
Format support: Nexus, MSF, Clustal, FASTA, PHYLIP, MASE

Name: Seqotron
Other features: Manual alignment, tree visualisation
Format support: Nexus, Clustal, FASTA, PHYLIP, MEGA, Stockholm, NBRF/PIR, GDE flat

Name: Sequilab
Other features: Link alignment results to analysis tools (Primer design, Gel mobility and Maps, Plasmapper, siRNA design Epitope prediction), Save research logs, Create custom toolbars
Format support: Accession number, GI number, PDB ID, FASTA, drag-drop from external URL from within the user interface

Name: Sequlator
Other features: easy alignment editing

Name: SnipViz
Other features: Pure Javascript and HTML; suitable to integrate in websites

Name: Strap
Structure prediction tools integrated: Jnet, NNPREDICT, Coiled coil, 16 different TM-helix
Other features: Dot-plot, structure-neighbors, 3D-superposition, Blast-search, Mutation-SNP analysis, Sequence features, BioJava-interface
Format support: MSF, Stockholm, ClustalW, Nexus, FASTA, PDB, Embl, GenBank, hssp, Pfam

Name: Tablet
Other features: High-performance graphical viewer for viewing next generation sequence assemblies and alignments.
Format support: ACE, AFG, MAQ, SOAP2, SAM, BAM, FASTA, FASTQ, GFF3

Name: UGENE
Can align sequences: MUSCLE, Kalign, ClustalW, ClustalO, ClustalX, MAFFT, T-Coffee, Smithâ€“Waterman algorithm
Other features: Many
Format support: FASTA, FASTQ, GenBank, EMBL, ABIF, SCF, ClustalW, Stockholm, Newick, PDB, MSF, GFF

Name: VISSA sequence-structure viewer
Other features: Mapping from sequence to 3D structure

Name: DNApy
Other features: Editing of GenBank files, plasmid drawing, ABI chromatograms,

Name: Alignment Annotator
Can align sequences: By sequence or mixed sequence and structure
Other features: DAS and user defined annotations. Scriptable. Export to HTML, Word, Jalview.
